The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued detailed guidelines regarding the use and verification of digital evidence in criminal investigations. The guidelines aim to ensure authenticity, prevent tampering, and protect the rights of individuals during electronic data collection.

According to the judgment, law enforcement agencies must maintain proper documentation of how digital devices are seized, stored, and examined. The court emphasized the importance of maintaining an unbroken chain of custody and using certified forensic tools for data extraction.

The guidelines aim to ensure authenticity, prevent tampering, and protect the rights of individuals during electronic data collection.

According to the judgment, law enforcement agencies must maintain proper documentation of how digital devices are seized, stored, and examined. The court emphasized the importance of maintaining an unbroken chain of custody and using certified forensic tools for data extraction.

Legal experts said the decision would improve transparency in cybercrime investigations and reduce the chances of wrongful convictions based on manipulated digital records. The court also directed lower courts to undergo training programs related to digital forensics.
